snippet: Setting the tone for Wednesday’s questioning of Mary T. Barra, the chief of General Motors, Senator Claire McCaskill said the company had a “culture of cover-up” that discouraged quick action to fix a defective part.
abstract: General Motors chief executive Mary T Barra faces tough questioning during hearing of House subcommittee tasked with investigating GM's ignition-switch recall.

byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and MATTHEW L. WALD
byline.contributor: Hilary Stout contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Setting the tone for Wednesday’s questioning of Mary T. Barra, the chief of General Motors, Senator Claire McCaskill said the company had a “culture of cover-up” that discouraged quick action to fix a defective part.

headline.main: G.M. Chief Faces Ire of Senators in Hearing
headline.print_headline: G.M. Chief Faces Ire of Senators in Hearing

keywords.value: Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
keywords.name: organizations
